statements: UPSERT INTO Products (product_id, product_name, price, category) VALUES (1, 'ProductA', 10.50, 'CategoryA')
UPSERT INTO Products (product_id, product_name, price, category) VALUES (2, 'ProductB', 15.75, 'CategoryB')
UPSERT INTO Products (product_id, product_name, price, category) VALUES (3, 'ProductC', 20.25, 'CategoryC')
INSERT INTO products (product_id, product_name, price) VALUES (1, 'Product A', 10.50) ON CONFLICT (product_id) DO UPDATE SET product_name = 'Product A', price = 10.50;
INSERT INTO products (product_id, product_name, price) VALUES (2, 'Product B', 20.75) ON CONFLICT (product_id) DO UPDATE SET product_name = 'Product B', price = 20.75;
INSERT INTO orders (order_id, product_id, quantity, order_date) VALUES (1, 1, 5, '2022-01-15') ON CONFLICT (order_id) DO UPDATE SET product_id = 1, quantity = 5, order_date = '2022-01-15';
INSERT INTO customers (customer_id, name, email) VALUES (1, 'John Doe', 'john.doe@example.com') ON CONFLICT (customer_id) DO UPDATE SET name = excluded.name, email = excluded.email;

INSERT INTO orders (order_id, customer_id, total_amount, order_date) VALUES (101, 1, 50.00, '2022-01-05 10:00:00') ON CONFLICT (order_id) DO UPDATE SET total_amount = excluded.total_amount, order_date = excluded.order_date;
INSERT INTO products (product_id, name, price) VALUES (201, 'Product A', 25.99) ON CONFLICT (product_id) DO UPDATE SET name = excluded.name, price = excluded.price;

UPSERT INTO products (product_id, product_name, price, category) VALUES (1, 'Product A', 10.99, 'Category A') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name = 'Product A', price = 10.99, category = 'Category A';
UPSERT INTO orders (order_id, customer_id, order_date, total_amount) VALUES (1, 101, '2022-10-20', 50.75) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE customer_id = 101, order_date = '2022-10-20', total_amount = 50.75;

UPSERT INTO customers (customer_id, customer_name, email, address) VALUES (101, 'John Doe', 'john.doe@example.com', '123 Main St') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE customer_name = 'John Doe', email = 'john.doe@example.com', address = '123 Main St';
UPSERT INTO customers (customer_id, customer_name, email, address) VALUES ('123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000', 'John Doe', 'john.doe@example.com', '123 Main St')
UPSERT INTO products (product_id, product_name, price, category) VALUES ('223e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001', 'Product A', 19.99, 'Electronics')
